stimulusHtml: A closed system consists of two identical metal blocks at different temperatures. Initially, one block has a temperature twice that of the other. The blocks are placed in thermal contact and isolated from their surroundings. A student claims that the entropy of the isolated system increases over time. Is the studentâ€™s claim correct? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the process of reaching thermal equilibrium is irreversible.
Yes, because the two blocks will continue to cool after reaching thermal equilibrium.
No, because in a closed system the entropy remains constant.
No, because the system moves toward a more orderly state of uniform temperature
